text.13_Chapter, 15_Verse: The wise person fears and avoids evil, but the fool is entangled in foolishness and delights in it.
text.15_Chapter, 0_Verse: From a person is the stirring of the heart, and from God is the speech of the tongue.
text.15_Chapter, 1_Verse: All the ways of a man are pure in his own eyes, but God establishes his paths.
text.15_Chapter, 2_Verse: Reveal your work to God, and your thoughts will be established. [This suggests that by being open and honest with God about your actions, He will help guide and refine your thoughts and intentions.].
text.15_Chapter, 3_Verse: All the deeds of God are for those who listen to Him, but the wicked are for a day of calamity.
text.15_Chapter, 4_Verse: God distances himself from all who are haughty in heart; from evil they will not be cleansed....
text.15_Chapter, 5_Verse: Through goodness and truth, iniquity is atoned for, and the fear of God keeps one away from evil.
text.15_Chapter, 6_Verse: When God is pleased with a person's ways, even their enemies make peace with them.
text.15_Chapter, 7_Verse: Better a little with righteousness than great income without justice.
text.15_Chapter, 8_Verse: A person's heart plans their way, but God directs their steps.
text.15_Chapter, 9_Verse: A divination is on the lips of the king, and his mouth does not transgress in judgment
